review_title: Great Company with a Great Mission
pros: The mission of this company is what initially led me to apply. The leadership team is dedicated and supportive and the work environment is challenging but fun.
cons: Staffing post pandemic has been challenging although this is probably true of most healthcare organizations these days.

job_title: MD- Family Medicine in Round Rock, TX
pros: Uninsured patient population, strict policies on narcotics
cons: No administrative time allowed for documentation

pros: Learning from all the nurses and providers on a daily.
cons: Communication, promotion, cool kids circle, lack of open door,

pros: Competitive salary. Helping vulnerable populations. And nothing else
cons: This is absolutely the worst workplace I've ever had the misfortune of being part of. There is extremely poor/non-existent communication both within and between departments. Example: me and my coworkers were notified that an orientation checklist was due to HR before we even started at our clinic, and yet we never received any actual orientation to our site even after months. Training/orientation is an absolute joke, a waste of time, and not clinically relevant at all. The culture really reminded me of a cult. You have no control or any notification about your schedule as a provider. The EMR used is the worst one I've ever used, and it was a common occurrence for documentation to be deleted/disappear from the system after charting, as well as for providers to ask for other members of the organization to terminate their EMR session multiple times a day as it constantly freezes i.e. a huge waste of resources and time. The EMR is not intuitive at all and features many redundant and time-wasting processes. Providers are harshly judged by metrics that you are not informed about, no matter if the metrics are relevant at all to what the patient is actually coming in for. They do not care at all about the patient care you provide, only if your numbers look good. The patient population's needs get very complex, yet there is absolutely no flexibility in the amount of time you have with each patient. This is absolutely the type of practice where underserved patients deserve more time for all the medical issues they have, yet you are incentivized to get them in and out like a cog in a machine. You do not have any admin time, despite the reality that healthcare providers need and deserve set time to deal with all the administrative tasks that pile up as well as complete charts. This results in you inevitably always working more hours than the standard work week, and of course the company is happy to have you work extra hours for no additional compensation. There is absolutely no wonder why most providers I saw here were drained and burnt out. If there were no federal loan forgiveness, I have no doubt that the number of providers working here would drop precipitously because of the horrible working conditions. I have never been in a darker mental space from a workplace. Providers must sign an employment contract and you are told there is no room for negotiation. This contract includes a non-compete clause, a provision that has been ruled by the Federal Trade Commission as anti-competitive and is set to be banned later this year. These clauses have been shown in studies to significantly suppress pay for workers as well as productivity. I would advise any potential employee to think long and hard about if they want to work for a company that explicitly participates and enforces in a predatory clause that restricts your future and options, and that is soon to be illegal. A prior review also mentions that some of the realities of Lone Star are 'par for the course'. I have worked in several different medical practices, and none of them even came close to how horrible this place is to work at. I wouldn't wish even my worst enemy to work here.

pros: Management very receptive to feedback. Great camaraderie within the clinic family and across the organization.

job_title: Clinical Support Specialist in Austin, TX
pros: The benefits are good and are affordable.
cons: If you start mid year, your annual raise is prorated, so even if you work yourself harder than anyone else and get a higher score...it is worth less than 25cents. You can work 40 accts no errors and still make the same as one who works 20 accts and half have errors.

pros: Lone Star Circle of Care is the gem of Georgetown. I love the people I work with - administration/finance/legal groups in Georgetown are professional, collaborative, and talented. Our computer systems, hardware and IT support are state of the art and I feel like I have all the tools I need to do my job. I am very proud to work for a company with such creative ideas for fulfilling its mission.
cons: I really enjoy working here- no cons.

pros: Benefits, PTO, Work from Home

review_title: With Lone Star Circle of Care (LSCC) for Six Months
job_title: Quality, Health and Safety Administrative in Georgetown, TX
pros:
The company is focused on taking care of and retaining employees that work for them. Great place to work, great co-workers, team environment, really focused on providing care to people in the community who really need help/ medical care in Bell, Travis, and Williamson counties. 

Co-workers are very friendly, I was surprised by how I was welcomed into the company within the first few week of being here,  I really feel as if I have been here for years not six months. The new hire process was great, very easy to get started and the orientation new hire process was well managed by organized people which made my transition to the company very smooth. 

I would recommend working here to anyone who asked me about it.
cons: None that i have seen so far. Great place to work.

pros: Good salary, benefits, great providers, nice facility
cons: Too many providers getting promotions at the expense of patients.  These are patients who are uninsured, underinsured, low-income, homeless... these are the "forgotten", the ones that need care the most and they're getting rescheduled time and time again with other doctors because so many doctors are leaving or are getting promoted.  Patients need stability and they're not getting it here.  3 doctors leave and the newly hired doctor takes on 3 doctors-load of patients.  We cannot provide the level of care we know we can by doing this.  The company wins with revenue, but more importantly, our patients lose.

review_title: Glad I Joined the LSCC Team
job_title: RN Care Coordinator in Georgetown, TX
pros: I have been a Nurse for 12 years and have worked in many different environments. The place I work at has caring and involved management. They have created a approachable relationship with all staff members and have a quick turnaround (fix) to any issue or question. The positive culture reflects with my fellow co-workers, in that they too are friendly and proactive in their work. This is the first place I have worked where staff members do not need to be redirected to their responsibilities. The work is challenging but the team I am surrounded by set me up for success. The benefits are affordable in comparison to other places I have worked.
cons: The only Con is that there is no Tuition Reimbursement program at this time. However we have been notified that is coming in the near future.

review_title: Nepotism persists, The Board needs to wash their hands of the entire Administrative team.
pros:
-Most of the regular staff are very friendly and easy to get along with, they were just frustrated that their voice was not being heard. 
-Good benefits and there were some great ideas coming forth to navigate through the dynamic ACA.
cons:
-Way too many executives, and this is coming from a former Administrator.
-Healthcare Providers first, staff second, Leadership should work for them not the other way around.
-Poor leadership and nepotism persists. As some other reviewers said it before me the "In-crowd" are the ones that still have their jobs because they are sheltered from any repercussions.

pros: When I started at Lone Star Circle of Care I felt like it was the perfect fit for my personality and skill set.  The company saw my skills and has encouraged me and trained me to be great at my job.  The employees are all helpful, friendly and work hard to bring outstanding care to our patients.  The CEO is committed, hard working and shows her employees how much she appreciates them.  The senior leadership is focused, they have shown how to get things done prior to and during the COVID-19 pandemic.  I love my job and the people I work with.  They all have great work ethic, are wonderful to work with, and work together to reach the company  goals.
cons: I have no cons about my position at the company.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Georgetown, TX
pros: Lone Star Circle of Care is great. I work in the Patient Navigation Center and we really work as a team. Management is always willing to help and have "Open Door" for us employees. they always make a little time for us when we have a concern. Co-workers are great and are always willing to help on any questions that one might have.
cons: Really I don't have much cons.. maybe only that we are super busy all the time. But it just really makes your day go by faster.

pros:
Great mission
Great facilities
Great doctors and nurses
Great upward mobility
Good place for young professionals with no experience and the right education or connections to be quickly promoted to leadership and highly paid positions.
cons: Unfortunately, the company is not so much focused on the mission as it is on money and community prestige. The salaries at the top levels are pretty high for an organization that is committed to those without monetary resources. Also, there are significant numbers of highly-paid, young senior leaders while the clinics are not staffed nearly so well. For example, at last count, the 500 or so employee organization had 5 attorneys. It is sad to see it continue to succeed with somewhat shady business practices. Not a good place for those truly interested in great patient care.

pros: Was close to my home.  Employees were friendly, warm, and believed in mission.
cons: Executive level leaders have questionable work ethics. They are self promoting, spend too much money on fleet vehicles and lavish business dinners, routine catered meals, all on grant money. They only promote those that fit in with their personal lifestyle.

review_title: As as medical billing specialist I'm able to see the beginning to end process on getting medical bills paid.
pros: The organization is great, for the most part the mission they have set out to serve the underinsured makes anyone happy to work for a company like Lone Star.
cons: Management at Lone Star is very unorganized, they cater to specific groups with in the billing department specifically and do a terrible job at creating a team work environment.

pros: Lone Star Circle of Care is a wonderful non-profit organization with collaborative & hard working team members.  A great team that thinks outside the box, embraces innovation and passionate to make a difference in the community.  I really appreciate being part of a company that promotes within, has strong diversity, and exhibits transparency.
cons: I notice some voices not being heard at times when it comes to providing feedback to managers.

pros: Nonprofit Structure, Competitive Pay, Large Organization with various intersections which allow employees to cross into alternate positions and fields,  Nice facilities
cons: Incompetent, greedy (bordering on gluttonous) upper management, who create a trickle-down effect of negative energy that pervades every part of what would otherwise be a pure mission to care for the less able.  Billing practices and nonprofit mission should be audited by the federal government since so much of the funding for this organization comes from federal grants--it is just a massive, unwieldy waste of taxpayer dollars.

pros:
Positive people in leadership roles
Strong team approach to overcome obstacles
Leadership seeks creative ideas to promote growth
Joint Commission accredited
Pleasant staff
CEO reaches out to staff- there is transparency to the company's growth
cons:
Staff turnover from providers affect growth.
Difficult for a person who cannot be flexible with his/her role changes
May need to wear many hats- again, need to be adaptable to a busy work environment.

pros: I really enjoyed the opportunity for growth within the company. My supervisor really cared about my advancement within the company, and was open to including me in projects that would get me to where I wanted to go.
cons: There are silos, which hinders the ability to accomplish the company's mission.

review_title: No longer the same wonderful company it was originally. Mission now caters to administration leaders, not patients.
pros: Several co-workers and clinical staff who support each other and care deeply for patients.
cons: Administration Leadership that took over after original group are too self-absorbed. Frivolous money being spent on themselves was over-the-top. I believe their frivolous spending and over inflated salaries led to the recent layoffs.

pros: Works hard to follow established protocols consistent with high quality of care. Extensive training, attention to detail. Open to input from Staff/Clinicians.
cons: little time off, long hours

review_title: strives to provide community with quality care
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Round Rock, TX
pros: I believe in the mission and strongly agree they have helped thousands of central Texans.
cons: Sacrificing quality of care by minimizing the allotted appointment times just so providers can see more patients per day. Those are stressful conditions for anyone and allows for a larger margin for errors.

pros: Lone Star Circle of Care has been a great place to work. Like with any company, there have been moments of stress. But through strong leadership and a clear mission we have been able to get through it. The challenges are daily and varied and leave me satisfied. I have grown a lot working here.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: strong leadership with transparent communication and visible presence, focused on our mission which is to provide quality and accessible healthcare,  competitive salary, great people to work with, various challenging projects to be involved in, management is open to new ideas and implementing them.
cons: most benefits are good and competitive, but there are a couple of areas that need improvement

pros: Lone Star Circle of Care really believes in the mission of caring for the under-insured and those most in need of quality healthcare. This company has great benefits and offers to opportunity to function in a very organic and dynamic atmosphere.
cons: The work can be quite intense
